article:
A 'pharmacophore' is an abstract description of molecular features which are
necessary for molecular recognition of a ligand by a biological macromolecule.
The IUPAC defines a pharmacophore to be "an ensemble of steric and electronic
features that is necessary to ensure the optimal supramolecular interactions
with a specific biological target and to trigger (or block) its biological
response". A pharmacophore model explains how
structurally diverse ligands can bind to a common receptor site. Furthermore
pharmacophore models can be used to identify through denovo design or virtual
screening novel ligands that will bind to the same receptor.
